Name.label: Immunodeficiency due to absence of thymus

TextSection.Contents: A rare primary immunodeficiency with autosomal or X-linked recessive inheritance, characterized by atrophy of the thymus in the absence of other congenital abnormalities, with profound T-cell deficiency, while serum immunoglobulin levels are normal or increased. Patients present with chronic or recurrent infections in infancy including candidiasis, skin, pulmonary and urinary tract infections, chronic diarrhea, and failure to thrive.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
